title: Virginia Norwood, ‘Mother’ of Satellite Imaging Systems, Dies at 96
description: A pioneer in aerospace, she invented a technology that has enabled scientists to map and study the earth for more than 50 years.

title: What to Know About Buying Electric Cars and the New Emissions Rule
description: Here is what car buyers need to know about the Biden administration’s proposal to push the auto industry to sell more electric cars.

title: Montana’s Plan to Bank TikTok Is a Preview for the Rest of the Country
description: The fight has shown the difficult test and legally perilous road facing lawmakers or the White House if they try to enact a national ban on the social media service.

title: NPR to Suspend Twitter Use After ‘Government-Funded’ Label
description: The broadcaster said that the label undermined its credibility “by falsely implying that we are not editorially independent.”

title: What Good Are Wearable Computers if the Data Is Wrong?
description: An Apple Watch or a Garmin can draw incorrect conclusions about your health, but the broad trends may be more valuable than the numbers.

title: Mass Layoffs and Absentee Bosses Create a Morale Crisis at Meta
description: Workers at Facebook’s parent have been increasingly alarmed by job cuts and the company’s direction.
